Name: Tax Exemption, Residential Parcels
Title: A Local Law to amend the New York City Charter in relation to the provisions of group proceedings before the tax commission on applications for correction of assessment for taxation for certain residential parcels.
Text:
Be it enacted by the Council as follows:

	Section one.  Section 164 of the New York City Charter is amended by adding a new paragraph (c) to read as follows:
	c.	Where twenty five (25) or more persons or corporations claiming to be aggrieved by the assessed valuation for twenty five (25) or more residential one, two or three family properties, including such properties classified as S-1 or S-2 by the finance department, file applications for correction of their assessments, such applicants may file as a group.  Such a group may be represented by the same individual and may request that their group proceedings be conducted at a geographic location at or near their properties.  Such request shall be granted by the tax commissioner and such proceedings shall be held at a location agreed to in good faith by the commissioner and the group representative.
	ï¿½2.	This local law shall take effect immediately.
